content.question: The population of rabbits in a national park is modeled by the function <math alttext="P"><mi>P</mi></math> given by <math alttext="P open parentheses t close parentheses equals 500 plus 100 cos open parentheses pi over 3 t close parentheses"><mi>P</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>500</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>100</mn><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mrow><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>, where <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math> is measured in years for <math alttext="0 less or equal than t less or equal than 15"><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>15</mn></math>. Based on this model, for <math alttext="0 less or equal than t less or equal than 15"><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>15</mn></math>, at what time <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math> is the first time that the rabbit population equals <math alttext="400"><mn>400</mn></math> ?

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Solve equations and inequalities represented analytically, with and without technology.
